label: Rise of Kutai
description: Establishment of the Kutai Martadipura Kingdom, the earliest known Hindu kingdom in Indonesia.

label: Rise of Srivijaya
description: The Srivijaya maritime empire establishes itself as a dominant power in Sumatra and the Malay Archipelago.

label: Establishment of Perlak
description: Establishment of the Sultanate of Perlak, often cited as the earliest Islamic kingdom in the region.

label: Founding of Majapahit
description: Raden Wijaya establishes the Majapahit Empire, which would become the largest empire in Indonesian history.

label: Portuguese capture Malacca
description: The Portuguese conquest of Malacca marks the beginning of European colonial presence in the archipelago.

label: Fall of Majapahit
description: The Majapahit Empire falls to the Demak Sultanate, marking the end of the Hindu-Buddhist era in Java.

label: Dutch capture Malacca
description: The Dutch seize Malacca from the Portuguese, consolidating their power in the region.

label: Daendels Arrives
description: Herman Willem Daendels arrives as Governor-General, implementing major administrative and military reforms under French influence.

label: British Interregnum
description: The British invade Java and establish a short-lived administration under Stamford Raffles.

label: Dutch Ethical Policy
description: Introduction of the Ethical Policy, aiming to improve the welfare of the indigenous population and unintentionally fostering nationalism.

label: Japanese Occupation
description: Japan occupies the Dutch East Indies during World War II, effectively ending Dutch colonial rule.

label: Proclamation of Independence
description: Sukarno and Hatta proclaim the independence of Indonesia on August 17th.

label: Recognition of Sovereignty
description: The Netherlands formally recognizes Indonesian sovereignty after four years of diplomatic and armed struggle.

label: Reformasi
description: The fall of President Suharto marks the beginning of the Reformasi era and the transition to democracy.
